info.title: Creditsafe Connect
info.description:
Last Updated: 26th July 2023

Creditsafe Connect is a REST API that provides access to the Creditsafe Global Company Database. This allows you to:
  • Control your master data
  • Utilize up-to-date Business and Director information, enhancing your onboarding and qualification processes
  • Receive alerts when your customer's and supplier's Credit Report changes

Check the status of Creditsafe Services HERE

Customer Feedback

Use the buttons below to let us know what you think of this documentation. Please leave comments in your feedback for the author to consider for future versions.



Selecting one of the buttons above will open a new tab to the feedback portal.

Quick Start

To start your Creditsafe Connect API integration you will need to have activated your account and set a password by following the instructions in your Welcome Email. If you have not received a Welcome Email please contact your Creditsafe Account Manager.

By default, you will have been setup on our Sandbox environment.

Using a REST API client construct an `/authenticate` POST request and enter your username & password (case-sensitive) into the POST body. A successful response will return an `authentication token`.

Use the `authentication token` in an `Authorization` header on all other Creditsafe Connect calls as proof of your authenticity.

Environments

Production Environment baseurl: https://connect.creditsafe.com/v1
Sandbox Test Environment baseurl: https://connect.sandbox.creditsafe.com/v1

Resources

  • OpenAPI specification.
  • Postman Collection of the most common example calls to Creditsafe Connect.
  • A Front End Demo Site. Use this as a quick easy way to validate your username & password and form requests.
  • Help Articles including:
    • FAQs
    • Data Dictionaries
    • Data Availability per Country
    • Feature Availability Matrix
    • Connect API Response Codes


Versioning and Changes

Non-Breaking Changes

These will be as a rule, additive functions or bug fixing. It is important that the code is integrated in such a way that it does not depend on which order items are returned.

Breaking Changes

This is when changes to the functionality will break the contract of the current API. This will invoke stakeholder communication and major version number update.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description:
Endpoint to generate a Bearer JWT (Authentication Token). It is mandatory to include this token under the Header `Authorization` When calling all other endpoints as proof of authenticity. Tokens can exist concurrently and persist for 1 hour from its issued time.

Authenticate Help - Access Denied..

tags.name: Companies
tags.description: Endpoints to search for Companies in the Creditsafe Global Company Database. Companies are uniquely identified by the `connectId` - the identifier used to order a Company Credit Report. The Company Credit Report is a JSON object comprising of key business and financial data points such as Credit Score & Limit, Industry Code, Directors, Balance Sheet and Negative Information. A full list of Company data points can be found in the Data Matrix, in the help resources.

tags.name: People/Directors
tags.description:
Endpoints to find People/Directors and order Director Reports. A Director Report will contain a person's registered information and Active & Previous Directorships, where available. This endpoint is not advised to get a list of directors for a specific Company. Instead, order a Company Credit Report using the `/companies/{id}` endpoint, and use the `directors` section in the response.

Please refer to the following matrix for 'persons report' availability in each country:

Feature Availability Matrix

tags.name: Images
tags.description: Endpoints to order official Company Image/Filing Documents from source. Company Filings such as Annual Account Statements, Annual Returns, Liquidations and Changes of Registered Information can be downloaded as PDFs, and are typically used as a resource in extended company auditing/compliance.

tags.name: Fresh Investigations
tags.description: Endpoints to manage Fresh Investigation requests. With the need for accurate data, you can check on any company that is not available within our instant online database by placing a Fresh Investigation (Offline Order). Depending on the market, the information we obtain will vary. Using official sources and registries we are able to quickly answer questions about a company's stability and financial health. Where official information is not available we will conduct a direct interview with the business.

tags.name: Global Monitoring
tags.description:
Endpoints to Monitor changes to Company Information. Company changes can be retrieved by creating a Portfolio (a collection of companies) and configuring the `eventRules` (the criteria in which to trigger a change, e.g. company name changes, limit changes) on the portfolio. When a company in your Portfolio changes to satisfy an eventRule, a `notificationEvent` will be raised to inform you of the nature of the change. See here for Creditsafe's Global Monitoring capabilities.

Global Monitoring Basic Integration Guide

tags.name: Decision Engine
tags.description: Endpoints to access pre-configured decision trees to automate credit decisions. Decision Engine can help you save time and money across your company by automating time consuming processes which drain your company's resources. This can free you and your staff to spend more time to work on achieving your business goals.</br></br>A full audit trail of previous decisions is maintained for user access and decisions in a pending state can be manually approved or declined.

tags.name: Protect
tags.description:
The focus on screening clients and third parties is increasing. International regulators are demanding that firms improve their ongoing sanctions screening process. World Compliance data through Connect allows customers to mitigate risk around Anti-Bribery and Corruption under local and international regulations such as the UK Bribery Act, by enabling users to screen their third party agents, suppliers or employees against watch lists. With World Compliance through Creditsafe Connect, compliance is easy, efficient and cost-effective, even as the regulatory mountain grows.

How to use Protect API Document

tags.name: Protect Profile
tags.description: Profiles can be used as an additional category to group related investigations together. For instance - You may want to investigate all  Branches, Directors and Shareholders of one business, and keep them in the same Profile.

tags.name: Protect Investigations
tags.description:
An Investigation is the terminology used within Protect for a search.

Investigations are created against Businesses or Individuals, but you also need to decide which additional parameters you have available to base your Investigation on. This is typically a Name and an Address.

Searches are exclusively populated by Businesses and Individuals that meet a strict criteria e.g. They possess PEPs, SEOs, Sanctions.

tags.name: Protect Audit
tags.description: Provides a log of all actions taken against endpoints to evidence any necessary that checks were carried out correctly.

tags.name: Protect Schedules
tags.description: A Schedule has a 1:1 relationship with an Investigation. Investigations that are scheduled will automatically check for new re-screen your initial search criteria on a nightly basis allowing you to review any new alerts each day.

tags.name: Protect IDV
tags.description: Person identity verification by validating against other known sources.

tags.name: Protect Batch Uploads
tags.description:
Allows for a file to be uploaded to create multiple searches.

Once the status is 'Complete' you can view all the files by calling - GET List all Protect Investigations.

Refer to the 'Selected Template' endpoint for help guide and file header templates.

tags.name: Local Solutions
tags.description: A toolbox of country-specific functionality. See the description under each endpoint for more information on a particular solution.

tags.name: GB Consumers and AML
tags.description: The identity service endpoints are used to run GB Consumer and AML searches. You must specify the product type and search parameters you want to obtain a response for in the body of the request.

tags.name: Data Cleaning
tags.description: A suite of endpoints to allow you to upload, map, match and then append Creditsafe company data to your own master data. Maintaining the quality of company data is of greatest importance to ensure efficiency and maximisation of opportunity.

tags.name: Consumers
tags.description: Endpoints to order Consumer Reports. In order to order a Consumer Report, sufficient information to uniquely identify the Consumer (search criteria) must be provided to filter potential results down to one record. When one record has been found, the returned object will be the Consumer Report. Currently only piloting with German Consumers.

tags.name: Misc
tags.description: Supporting endpoints for metadata/discovery. Not frequently used directly in integrations.

tags.name: Change Log
tags.description:
List of updates to the connect API documentation.

Feature being developed

post.description:
Supply username and password to generate Authentication Token.

Rate Limiting Authenticate

Rate limiting has been made active on the authenticate endpoint. The following basis makes up the rate limiting which will need to be accounted for:

  • 5 of the same invalid requests are allowed within 2 minutes.
  • After 5 invalid requests, customer will get 429 HTTP Status for the same request.
  • After 2 minutes, you can re-call the endpoint and will get 401s (as the credentials are invalid).

get.description: Endpoint to search for Companies according to the provided Search Criteria. To get the most relevant results, it is recommended to use a unique identifier such as `regNo` where available. If a unique identifier is not available, use a combination of the companies registered `postCode` and `name` for the next best hit rate.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description:
comma-separated list of iso-2 country codes.
The code `PLC` can be used here to search for companies of this type across all countries.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description:
Only used for Countries where more than one Company Name exists for different languages e.g. Japanese Kanji and English.
Country - Languages Available
Brazil [BR] - EN & PT
Japan [JP] - EN & JA

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: connectId - The primary Company identifier that is used to uniquely identify all companies across Creditsafes Universe and Partner Network. This is returned on all Company Search Results. Use this field to use in other operations such as Ordering Company Credit Report by Id, and Adding Company to Monitoring Portfolio.

parameters.name: safeNo
parameters.description: Safe Number - Identifier for Companies in Creditsafe's Home Countries.

parameters.name: regNo
parameters.description: Local Company Identifier - The Company identifier associated with it's Domestic Filing Agency. i.e. French SIREN/SIRET, United Kingdom Companies House CRN.

parameters.name: vatNo
parameters.description: Company VAT Number

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Company Name

parameters.name: tradeName
parameters.description: Trade Name of the Company, typically used in Countries where Name is not uniquely registered.

parameters.name: acronym
parameters.description: A (non-unique) identifier to look for Companies by their more commonly known acronym rather than their lesser known full name. Acronym is predominantly available on French Companies.

parameters.name: exact
parameters.description: Provide as `true` to find Companies matching a Name exactly.

parameters.name: street
parameters.description: Address part identifier - Street of the Company

parameters.name: houseNo
parameters.description: Address part identifier - House/Building Number of the Company

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Address part identifier - City of the Company

parameters.name: postCode
parameters.description: Address part identifier - Postcode/Zip Code of the Company. Can be provided partially to extend to a region with a * as a wildcard. I.e. CF* can represent all postcodes starting with CF.

parameters.name: province
parameters.description: Address part identifier - Province/State of the Company

parameters.name: callRef
parameters.description: Call Reference

parameters.name: phoneNo
parameters.description: Provides Array of phone numbers or Null

parameters.name: customData
parameters.description: Not currently used.

get.description:
Orders a Company Credit Report by connectId.

To acquire a PDF version of the report use the optional request in 'Header'.

This request will provide a 'Base64-encoded' script to convert to a PDF, this will appear at the end of the JSON response.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Applies request for PDF link to Company Report.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Report Language - The JSON structure of the Report is language invariant, but field content will return as the given language, where available.

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: Optional parameter to request a Templated Company Report. A Template adds/reduces sections of the Credit Report depending on your subscription. Do not include this parameter if you have not been given a template to use.

parameters.name: includeIndicators
parameters.description: Optional parameter to include the indicator scores in to a company report - `Covid Score` , `Financial Strength` , `Estimated Turnover`

parameters.name: customData
parameters.description: Additional Report Parameters e.g.  German Report Reason Code value is `de_reason_code::1` . Use /reportcustomdata/{country} endpoint to see all values.

parameters.name: callRef
parameters.description: Call Reference

parameters.name: connectId
parameters.description: The connectId (optionally Safe Number where available) of the Company required to order their Credit Report. Obtained from `/companies` search results.

get.description: Returns the available countries in your subscription - Company Report, Director Report, Offline Reports and Monitoring.
Returns the set of available Company Search parameters/fields for a provided list of countries.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: A comma separated list of ISO/Alpha 2 format country codes, or singular country Code. e.g. US,GB will return the common searchable Company fields in the United States and Great Britain.

get.description: Supply all company search criteria to find potential company matches ranked by a `single score`. - See here for more information.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Iso-2 country code

parameters.name: matchThreshold
parameters.description: Return matches above this score (900 - 999)

parameters.name: regNo
parameters.description: Local Company Identifier - The Company identifier associated with it's Domestic Filing Agency. i.e. French SIREN/SIRET, United Kingdom Companies House CRN.

parameters.name: vatNo
parameters.description: Company VAT Number

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Company Name

parameters.name: street
parameters.description: Address part identifier - Street of the Company

parameters.name: houseNo
parameters.description: Address part identifier - House/Building Number of the Company

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Address part identifier - City of the Company

parameters.name: postCode
parameters.description: Address part identifier - Postcode/Zip Code of the Company.

parameters.name: province
parameters.description: Address part identifier - Province of the Company

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Address part identifier - State of the Company

parameters.name: reference1
parameters.description: Customer supplied free text reference 1 of 3

parameters.name: reference2
parameters.description: Customer supplied free text reference 2 of 3

parameters.name: reference3
parameters.description: Customer supplied free text reference 3 of 3

parameters.name: callRef
parameters.description: Call Reference

get.description: Returns the set of available People Search parameters/fields for a provided list of countries.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: A comma separated list of ISO/Alpha 2 format country codes, or singular country Code. e.g. US,GB will return the common searchable People/Director fields in the United States and Great Britain.

get.description: Endpoint to find Directors based on search criteria to order a Creditsafe Director Report.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: comma-separated list of iso-2 country codes

parameters.name: peopleId
parameters.description: Person/Director Identifier - used to order a Director Report.

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Person's First Name.

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Person's Last Name

parameters.name: localDirectorNumber
parameters.description: Local Identifier of the Director, the PNR in GB.

parameters.name: dateOfBirth
parameters.description: Person DOB - provide YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM format.

parameters.name: callRef
parameters.description: Call Reference

get.description: Returns a report from the ID supplied to the search.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Report Language - The JSON structure of the Report is language invariant, but field content will return as the given language, where available.

parameters.name: callRef
parameters.description: Call Reference

parameters.name: peopleId
parameters.description: Identifier of the Person/Director required to order their Director Report. Obtained from `/people` search results.

get.description: Returns the available Images for a given Company connectId.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The company's connectId.

parameters.name: olderThan
parameters.description: Returns Images older than this date. Use with newerThan parameter.

parameters.name: newerThan
parameters.description: Returns Images newer than this date. Use with olderThan parameter.

get.description: Lists available Image Document formats, types and languages per country.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Filter Images by country.

get.description: Endpoint to order an Image Document by Image ID.

parameters.name: imageId
parameters.description: Image ID retrieved from `images/companies`

200.description: Image object as a binary stream.

post.description: Places an order for a Fresh Investigation (Offline Report). Providing as much detail as possible about the Company, our team will use official sources and registries to quickly answer questions about a company's stability and financial health. Fresh Investigations take 5.5 days on average to complete. By adding `consent:true` to the request, you are allowing Creditsafe to disclose your company details to the company you have requested the Investigation against, to be used only in the aim of improving our Investigation report.

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: Fresh Investigation Identifier used internally and with our data partners.

parameters.name: reportCreatedAfter
parameters.description: Returns Fresh Investigations processed after this date

parameters.name: reportCreatedBefore
parameters.description: Returns ordered Fresh Investigations that were processed before this date

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Returns Fresh Investigations created before this date

parameters.name: createdSince
parameters.description: Returns ordered Fresh Investigations created after this date

parameters.name: lookUpOrderBy
parameters.description: Use to search for your Fresh Investigations by either the returned Company Details in the `GET` `freshInvestigations/{orderId}` endpoint or your supplied Search Criteria in the `POST` `/freshInvestigations` endpoint

parameters.name: companyDetailsCountry
parameters.description: Looks for your returned Fresh Investigations where the returned Company Country is named this. Use with lookUpOrderBy=CompanyDetails

parameters.name: companyDetailsName
parameters.description: Looks for your returned Fresh Investigations where the returned Company Name is named this. Use with lookUpOrderBy=CompanyDetails

parameters.name: searchCriteriaCountry
parameters.description: Looks for your returned Fresh Investigations where your submitted Search Criteria Company Country is this. Use with lookUpOrderBy=searchCriteria

parameters.name: searchCriteriaName
parameters.description: Looks for your Fresh Investigations where your submitted Search Criteria Company Name is this. Use with lookUpOrderBy=searchCriteria

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sorts  returned Fresh Investigations by this field

get.description: Returns a list of your submitted Fresh Investigation Orders.
Returns a specific Fresh Investigation order.

parameters.name: sections
parameters.description: Specify a value to return a single section, or multiple-comma separated sections of the completed Fresh Investigation. Leave null to return all sections. Available sections; - `companyIdentification` - `creditScore` - `contactInformation` - `directors` - `otherInformation` - `groupStructure` - `extendedGroupStructure` - `financialStatements` - `negativeInformation` - `additionalInformation`- `directorships` - `localFinancialStatements` - `paymentData` - `companySummary` - `alternateSummary`

parameters.name: comments
parameters.description: Selects number of comments which should be returned with the order details.

200.description: Returns a specific Fresh Investigation Order. For completed orders this will contain the Investigation content as Report Sections.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Investigation id.

patch.description: Update the Fresh Investigation Report data for a specific order, after the order has a status of delivered.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Fresh investigation orderId

message.description: Success response of updated fresh investigation.

details.description: Provides further information on why the request was rejected

post.summary: Upload attachments for fresh investigation orderId
post.description: Returns the status of attachment upload for the partcular order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Fresh investigation orderId

get.summary: Get attachments for the given fresh investigation orderId
get.description: Returns attachments available for that particular order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: fresh investigation orderId

get.summary: Get attachment for the given fresh investigation attachment Id
get.description: Retrieve attachment for the given attachmentId.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: fresh investigation orderId

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: fresh investigation attachment id for the given order

post.description: Returns the status of comments for the particular order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: fresh investigation orderId

get.summary: Retrieve comments of specified FreshInvestigation Report
get.description: Returns the Fresh Investigation Report comments for a specific order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: FreshInvestigation Report Id

get.description: Returns the Fresh Investigation Report data for a specific order, after the order has a status of delivered.
You would use this endpoint to retrieve the user details related to the Global Monitoring product, such as the user's information.
This endpoint allows you to manage portfolios. You can use the GET method to retrieve all portfolios associated with the user.

parameters.name: searchQuery
parameters.description: Return portfolios that match the given value

post.description:
This endpoint to create a new Portfolio based on the supplied criteria.

A portfolio can contain any number of companies that you wish to monitor changes to. The only required Body parameter is "name" for Connect users.

Endpoint allows you to import a list of companies to add to the selected portfolio along with some personal information for the company. Importing a portfolio will add the companies to the specified portfolio, duplicates in the import file will be ignored.You may also optionally add an email to the body of the request and get an email notification when the import is processed..

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

post.description: Endpoint allows you to sync a portfolio file with your portfolio. Sync action will delete all companies in your specified portfolio, and then add the companies from the file into the portfolio.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

get.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve the portfolio details from the portfolioId.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the portfolio that you wish to retrieve, obtained from `/portfolios`.

delete.description: This endpoint allows you to delete the portfolio using the portfolioId.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio that you wish to delete, obtained from `/portfolios`.

patch.description: This endpoint allows you to update Portfolio details such as Name, email recipients, language and subject line.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

get.description: This endpoint provides a list of distinct countries associated with the companies monitored within a specific portfolio.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

get.description: This endpoints gets all companies from a specific portfolio based on the portfolio id, optionally filter with query parameters.

parameters.name: searchQuery
parameters.description: Return companies that match the given value

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Return <<resourcePathName>> that match the given countryCode

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

post.description: Endpoint to add a company using a company id, into a portfolio provided in as a path parameter. Optional fields can be used to add a personalReference, freeText, and personalLimit.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

correlationId.description: A unique ID assigned to this request.

message.description: A status message relating to your request.

post.description: This endpoint allows you to copy companies from one portfolio to another. You can specify the source and destination portfolios to perform the copy operation.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio you want to copy companies from, obtained from `/portfolios`.

parameters.name: copyAll
parameters.description: When CopyAll query parameter is False, portfolios and companies list needs to be passed. When CopyAll query parameter is True, only portfolios need to be passed and companies List must be empty. All companies are copied from current portfolio are considered here.

post.description: This endpoint allows you to move companies from one portfolio to single (or) multiple portfolios. Removes the companies from the portfolio provided in the path parameter.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio you want to move companies from, obtained from `/portfolios`.

parameters.name: removeAll
parameters.description: When RemoveAll query parameter is False, a portfolios and companies list needs to be passed. When RemoveAll query parameter is True, only portfolios need to be passed and companies List must be empty. All companies are moved and deleted from current portfolio.

patch.description: This endpoint allows for companies to be deleted from the specified portfolio.

parameters.name: clearAll
parameters.description: When ClearAll query parameter is False,Companies List needs to be passed. When ClearAll query parameter is True, Companies List must be empty. All companies will be deleted

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio you want to delete companies from, obtained from `/portfolios`.

get.summary: Get Company Details From A Portfolio
get.description: This endpoint allows you to get various company details from a portfolio. Requires a portfolioID and companyID in the PATH of the request.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: A company Safe Number or Connect ID.

delete.description: Endpoint to delete a company from a portfolio.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: A company Safe Number or Connect ID.

patch.description: Updates the company details in a specified portfolio.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: A company Safe Number or Connect ID.

get.description: Get all notification `eventRules` for the given `portfolioId`. Notification event rules allow you to control which events you wish to monitor for the `companies` contained within the given `portfolio`.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the portfolio that you wish to retrieve notification event rules for, obtained from `/portfolios`.

get.description: Endpoint to that lists all the eventRules, their status and parameters based on a portfolio Id, filtered by country. Newly created portfolios are without any notification event rules by default, but you can switch rules on/off per country or on a global basis. There are different rules available for each country due to the different type of change event data that's available. The following GET request lists all the available rules for a portfolio.
get.summary: List Portfolio Event Rules By Country

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Country code to show events for.

put.description: Endpoint to update an eventRule in a portfolio. Must provide a portfolio unique identifier and a country code in the URL of the PUT request. The Body of the request must contain the `ruleCode` number of the eventRule you want to update, with an `isActive` parameter. Some event rules may also contain specific parameters, which can be set with `param0`, `param1` and `param2`. parameters. Get the above information by calling the List All eventRules endpoint.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Country code to show events for

put.description: Update a portfolios event rules to default state. In Connect, default state means all rules are turned off.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

get.description: Get current portfolio risk summary information.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

get.description: Get all notificationEvents based on the portfolio id, optionally filter with query parameters.

parameters.name: searchQuery
parameters.description: Return notificationEvents that match the given value

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

get.description: List of notification events based on the company id,optionally filtered with query parameters.

parameters.name: searchQuery
parameters.description: Return notificationEvents that match the given value

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of items to return per Page (max 1000)

parameters.name: isProcessed
parameters.description: A flag that can be set to `true` boolean value to mark it as an event that has been actioned.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort results by this column. Null values of sort column are listed after non-nulls.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A company Safe Number or Connect ID.

get.description: Retrieve user permissions within the customer for a portfolio.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

patch.description: Update/Create user permissions within the customer for portfolio.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the portfolio, obtained from `/portfolios`.

get.description: Endpoint to return a collection of `events` for the given company, optionally filtered on the supplied search criteria. Event information will only be returned if the company exists in at least one of your `portfolios`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The connectId of the company that you wish to retrieve events for.

get.description: Get all available notification event rules. Notification event rules allow you to control which events you wish to monitor for the `companies` contained within a given `portfolio`.

Get all available notification event rules for the given `countryCode`. Notification event rules allow you to control which events you wish to monitor for the `companies` contained within a given `portfolio`.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: ISO/Alpha 2 format country code for which notification event rules will be returned.

get.description: Get all notification events generated for companies monitored in your portfolios, based on the notification rules enabled. The notification events returned will be filtered based upon the supplied search criteria.

parameters.name: searchQuery
parameters.description: Return notificationEvents that match the given value

get.description: Returns all instances (Decision Trees) a user has permission to access.

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the customer. If used it will return all the Decision Trees associated to that customer.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user. If used it will return all the Decision Trees that user has access to.

get.description: Returns instance user has permission to access.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Get results by guid.

put.description:
Update the instances information.

You will need to call the `GET /decisionEngine/instance/{guid}` endpoint to get the current configuration and then update the fields you want to change.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: get results by guid.

get.description: Returns all decision trees that the user has permission to access.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter the returned decision trees by their associated decision tree type.

get.description: Returns the user data fields defined for the given decision tree GUID.

parameters.name: provenirId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the decision tree, obtained from `/GUID`.

post.description: Runs the provided decision tree for the given company, optionally using the data provided in the body of the call.

parameters.name: provenirId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the decision tree to run, obtained from `/GUID`.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The Connect ID for the company that you wish to run the decision tree on. Obtained from `/companies` search results. A Connect ID is the primary Company identifier that is used to uniquely identify all companies across Creditsafe's Universe and Partner Network.

parameters.name: originationId
parameters.description: An optional field that will allow text passed through to be stored against the decision. Typically used for internal identifiers (e.g. SalesForce IDs).

schema.description: The POST body should contain the User Data Fields for the decision tree you want to run obtained via the `/{guid}/userDataFields` endpoint.

get.description: Returns a log of all previously ran decisions that the user has permission to access, optionally filtered.

parameters.name: provenirId
parameters.description: Filter the returned usage log by the GUID for the associated decision trees, obtained from `/GUID`.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Filter the returned usage log by the Connect ID for the associated companies for each decision.

parameters.name: companyName
parameters.description: Filter the returned usage log by the Company Name for the associated companies for each decision.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter the returned usage log by the status for each decision.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Filter the returned usage log by the date the the decision was run.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Filter the returned usage log by the date the the decision was run.

get.description: Returns a specified decision log for a previously ran decision.

parameters.name: decisionLogId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the decision log to retrieve, obtained from `/usageLog`.

patch.description: Updates the status and/or notes for a specified decision.

parameters.name: decisionLogId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the decision log to retrieve, obtained from `/usageLog`.

get.description: Consumer Search and Report endpoint. When sufficient information has been provided to filter potential Consumer results down to one record then the Consumer Report will be returned.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: ISO-2 country code

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Consumer's First Name

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Consumer's Last Name

parameters.name: street
parameters.description: Address part identifier - Street of the Consumer

parameters.name: houseNo
parameters.description: Address part identifier - House/Building Number of the Consumer

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Address part identifier - City of the Consumer

parameters.name: postCode
parameters.description: Address part identifier - Postcode/Zip Code of the Consumer

parameters.name: callRef
parameters.description: Call Reference

get.description: Returns country specific fields that can be used to search for a Consumer.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of ISO-2 country codes

parameters.name: callRef
parameters.description: Call Reference

post.description: Creates an Investigation according to the provided Investigation criteria. Each result is potential match which is attributed a relevancy/match score between 1-100 and a high level reason for it's inclusion in the World Compliance Database by looking at the Reason Listed and Comments to firstly ascertain whether the entry is a match for you search criteria and then utilize the data available for your own onboarding needs.

get.description: Endpoint to return all investigations. Filter response by using query parameters. Use the alertsCount parameter to only return Investigations with alerts greater than the supplied value.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Keyword search: It searches in the 'name' fields of the investigation.

get.description: Endpoint to return a specific Investigation by ID. Can also be used to retrieve the associated Schedule Id that has been linked to the Investigation.

delete.description: Deletes an Investigation by {Id} number. This will remove the entire Investigation and all results within it.

post.description:
Requires the 'Investigation Id' in path, followed by 'Record Id' in the request body to add a record to the previously created Investigation.

By adding InvestigationRecords you are confirming that the result is a match to your search criteria.

To return to the original Investigation search to allocate other records, use "GET Investigation results by ID.".

get.description: Requires the 'Investigation Id' in path.

parameters.name: investigationId
parameters.description: Investigation Id

put.description: Sends an update to the investigation specified by the ID and changes will be reflected within that investigation.

delete.description: Deletes a record from an Investigation ID.

get.description: Returns original Investigation search results to assign any other results to the records.

put.description: Allows user to update the risk with an Investigation.

post.description: Creates an investigation and returns a link to the report.
post.summary: Create Investigation And Return Report Link

post.description: This endpoint will Return a report by providing a file path.
Creates a note to a specific investigation ID.

get.description: Returns the notes created against a specific investigation ID.

post.description: Creates an empty profile for collating investigations.

get.description: Returns all profiles for the logged in user or filtered with a matching profile name.
Retrieves a profile by Id in the Path.

put.description: Endpoint to change the name of a profile.

get.description: Endpoint to retrieve all Investigations associated with a specific Profile.

put.description: Adds an Investigation to a Profile.

post.description: Creates a PDF that shows the full report for the selected entities. This report will include search criteria used, user, time/date stamp and full World Compliance Report. It is recommended to call this endpoint before adding InvestigationRecords to an Investigation, as only non-processed alerts populate the PDF.

Creates a Schedule to check against new sanctions that effect your chosen Investigation.
The frequency of the schedule is set to 'daily' as a default.

To receive notifications of alerts you need to follow this POST call with PUT/Update Schedules to set the 'isEmailRequired' to `true`.

put.description: Endpoint will update the details around the schedule.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Enter the schedule id.

get.description: Endpoint to retrieve a specific Schedule by Id. A Schedule Id can be retrieved from the associated Investigation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Enter the schedule id.

delete.description: Deletes a Schedule from an Investigation meaning entity will no longer be monitored on a nightly basis but record will still remain in the audit trail.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Enter the schedule id.

post.description: Creates a search request for a GDC IDV search.

get.description: Returns an IDV Report with the potential results and the sources they were matched against.
Returns logged interactions with Protect endpoints for audit purposes. Actions logged include creating an Investigation, Investigation Record and Schedule.

post.description: Produces a collection a csv of Audit records.

Endpoint to upload a file that generates multiple searches and investigations.

Note - file needs to be structured as per the template.

File.description: Uploads a file to the server in `csv` format. Ensure the file follows the same format as the template.

get.description: Returns all the Batch Uploads created by a user.
Will return the batch upload details of a specific file id.
Provides a link to the file in error.
Provides template for the file upload csv structure.

schema.description: `template` returns a header list for the file upload.

get.description: Allows users to return Land Registry details of a company.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: A company Safe Number or Connect ID.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: language the report is requested in.

get.description: The Bank Verification tool allows customers to instantly verify that small and medium sized companies you are working with are providing correct bank details, to reduce fraud and avoid delays in your on boarding process. The bank data for these companies is provided to Creditsafe by various financial providers, including major banks. When you provide us with a company number and their bank details, we are able to perform instant checks to verify that those bank details are associated with that company and return - </br> Match  We have bank information on the company, and the data provided by the customer matches the company records </br> No Match  We have bank information on the company, but the data provided does not match any of the company records </br> Data Unavailable - We do not have bank information on the company.

parameters.name: checkType
parameters.description: Validation uses an algorithm to determine if a SCAN or IBAN exists, but does not let you know if that SCAN or IBAN actually belongs to the company who has provided it. Verification takes this a step further and checks the Creditsafe database for a match on the SCAN/IBAN, and tells you if the bank details actually belong to the company, so you can be assured that you are sending your money to the correct entity.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The connectId or safeNumber of the company to check against.

parameters.name: sortCode
parameters.description: Sort Code to check - Must be passed in with Account Number to form a SCAN Result

parameters.name: accountNumber
parameters.description: Account Number to check - Must be passed in with Sort Code to form a SCAN Result

parameters.name: iban
parameters.description: IBAN to check

parameters.name: vatNumber
parameters.description: VAT Number to check

200.description: Indicates the check has been made successfully and contains the result of the Verification/Validation. A 200 response alone does not immediately indicate the bank account is valid, only that the check was made in the correct format. Check the SCAN text and IBAN text fields for the result of the Check.

post.summary: Submits a GB Consumer or AML Search
post.description: Submits a GB Consumer or AML depending on the Product provided. Validates criteria for each individual search before submitting, and may return a list of error strings instead.

put.summary: Resolves a picklist against a given UniqueId
put.description: Resolves a picklist belonging to the specified UniqueID, which would have been generated during a prior search. Guids (and thus cached searches) expire after fifteen minutes.

get.description: This will return the input criteria used in a search for a specified id.

Retrieves a prior search result. This will include the search input and any ID/AML searches, but as we cannot hold Consumer search results these are not included. Resubmission is necessary if an updated Consumer result is needed.
Returns an object describing which Reasons for Search are available and which are selected by a given customer. All reasons are always listed, with selected reasons specified as true.

get.summary: Gets a list of identitysearch history items
get.description: Retrieves a paginated history list for the specified customer/user, filtered based on the include* parameters.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The 1-indexed page number to fetch

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size number to fetch

parameters.name: IncludeCustomer
parameters.description: If true, returns all results for this customer. Valid for senior users only.

parameters.name: Products
parameters.description:
The array of products to include

**Below is a list of Definitions for the ENUM**
* 0 - Consumer
* 1 - Id
* 2 - AML
* 3 - Bank Match
* 4 - AML with Bank Match

parameters.name: DateFrom
parameters.description: The earliest date to include

parameters.name: DateTo
parameters.description: The latest date to include

parameters.name: Keyword
parameters.description: Include this string

parameters.name: Result
parameters.description: Return only items with this result

put.description: Allows you to set a reference for an existing history item. This is useful for storing a reference to the record in your own system.
put.summary: Sets the reference for an existing history item

parameters.name: uniqueId
parameters.description: The ID of the record to update

put.description: Revalidate's a given identitysearch with additional documents.
put.summary: Revalidate a given identitysearch with additional documents

parameters.name: uniqueId
parameters.description: The ID of the record to update

get.description: Finance Agreements allows users to view data supplied via the CCDS scheme (Commercial Credit Data Sharing ).Full CCDS allows a user to view up to 48 months' of historical data on current account, loanand credit card facilities. The Financial footprint shows summarised credit activity data.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The connectId or safeNumber of the company

get.description: Returns the Company Report JSON schema of the provided country. Largely redundant as the Company Report 200 response is defined as a superset of all country's JSON schemas and can be used for any country.

parameters.name: section
parameters.description: Use CompanyReportResponse for the Company Credit Report JSON schema, DirectorReportResponse for the Director Report JSON schema.

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: For Templated Company Report JSON Schemas

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: ISO2 / Alpha 2 Country Code

get.description: Returns the allowed values of the customData parameter, used in the GET Company Report and Director Report endpoints.  I.e. Supplying `DE` as a country code will return a list of reasons for requesting a DE Credit Report (a legal requirement to supply with each Credit Report request in Germany). This will provide a list of allowedValues to enter into the mandatory Parameter `customData` = `de_reason_code::allowedValue`.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: An ISO/Alpha-2 country code to display any special mandatory parameters when ordering a Credit Report in that territory.

description: 2 - Credit Assessment - Future business connection (with credit risk)
3 - Credit Assessment - Existing business connection (with credit risk)
5 - Purchase Contract - Intention of signature of purchase contract (with credit risk)
7 - Contract - Intention of signature of leasing or rent contract (with credit risk)
8 - Insurance Contract - Intention of signature of a insurance contract (with credit risk)

post.description: Enter a name for the 'Job Request' to be associated to the file going to be processed.

get.description: This endpoint can be used to retrieve all created data cleaning job requests as defined by the query parameters.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Comma separated list of ISO/Alpha-2 country codes to filter the results by.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Returns the individual jobs by status. Possible values are: `pending`, `processing`, `completed`, `failed`.

parameters.name: jobName
parameters.description: Returns the individual jobs by name.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Returns the individual jobs created after the specified date.

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Returns the individual jobs by customer id.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Returns the individual jobs created before the specified date.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Returns the individual jobs by user id.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Returns the number of individual jobs per page.

parameters.name: companyName
parameters.description: Returns the individual jobs by company name.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Returns the page number of the individual jobs.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Returns the individual jobs by archived status.

get.description: Returns Job by {id} number which is generated from 'Creating Job Request' stage. This endpoint is used to check the `status` of the job.

post.summary: Upload a Job File with an {id}
post.description: Upload a Job File for processing, you need to link to the {id} number generated from the 'Job Request'.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The {id} number generated from the 'Job Request'.

put.description: Update the mapping of the uploaded file to match that of the header within it. You can add or remove the required number of mapping points in the Request Body.

post.description: Submission of the file after mappings have been carried out. To have a successful submission a blank response body (See example) is required to be posted.

put.description:
Detail which package of enrichment settings are to be applied to the uploaded file.

Select one of the three creditTypes to acquire the JSON Enrichment tag schema possible for that product.

Removal of Enrichment tags is possible from each creditType. Addition of Enrichment tags to a creditType is not possible beyond the maximum schema for each.

post.description:
Commencing the Job enrichment to the uploaded file after mapping the enrichment requirements. To have a successful submission a blank response body (See example) is required to be posted.

POST 'enrich' will not commence unless the `Job Status` is `jobMatchingComplete`.

Use the GET/dataCleaning/jobs/{id} to check Status of job.

get.description: Returns the enriched file after enrichment is complete. Identify the file type to be returned via the query parameter.

post.description: Archives the job, this can be done at any stage. To have a successful submission a blank response body (See example) is required to be posted.

permissions.description: Comma separated permissions. "View" permission gets automatically added to the user if "Add", "Edit", "Remove" permissions are set.

correlationId.description: A unique ID assigned to this request.

portfolioId.description: A unique ID assigned to each portfolio.

customerId.description: A unique ID assigned to your customer account.

status.description: A message about the status of this request.

importcsv.description: The import file ideally needs to be a .csv file.

email.description: Option field. Provide an email and get a notification when the import has been completed with the details about the import.

correlationId.description: A unique ID assigned to this request.

status.description: A message about the status of this request.

id.description: The connectId of the company that triggered the `notificationEvent`. A connectId is the primary Company identifier that is used to uniquely identify all companies across Creditsafe's Universe and Partner Network.

safeNumber.description: The Safe Number (Creditsafe's identifier on all Companies owned in the Creditsafe Universe) of the company that triggered the `notificationEvent`.

name.description: The name of the company that triggered the `notificationEvent`.

countryCode.description: ISO/Alpha 2 format country code of the company that triggered the `notificationEvent`.

portfolioId.description: The portfolio Id of the portfolio that contains the company that triggered the `notificationEvent`.

portfolioName.description: The name of the portfolio that contains the company that triggered the `notificationEvent`.

size.description: The maximum number of results returned per page.

prev.description: The page number of the previous page, null if there is no previous page available.

next.description: The page number of the next page, null if there is no next page available.

last.description: The page number of the last page.

correlationId.description: A unique ID assigned to this request.

friendlyName.description: The name of the decision tree.

GUID.description: The unique reference for the decision tree.

type.description: The type of the decision tree.

serviceLine.description: The internal reference for the service line that credits will be deducted from on each decision tree run.

decisionEngineId.description: The unique reference for the decision tree.

fields.description: A list of user-input data fields that are supported by the provided decision tree. The values for these fields should be passed to the `/{guid}` endpoint call when running a decision.

orderIndex.description: Used to assist ordering of the user data fields on a UI.

label.description: The user-friendly label for the field for display on a UI.

paramName.description: The string value for the parameter to be used when calling the `/{guid}` endpoint.

fieldType.description: The type of user data field.

mandatory.description: Flag to dictate whether the user data field is required when running the associated decision tree.

label.description: The user-friendly label for the drop-down option for display on a UI.

presentationOrder.description: Used to assist ordering of the drop-down options on a UI.

validation.description: Optional validation rules that should be applied to the corresponding user data field prior to running the decision tree.

validationValue.description: The value for the validation rule.

description.description: A description for the validation rule.

Decision.description: The decision returned by the automated decision model.

DecisionText.description: The text output to accompany the decision returned by the decision model.
DecisionText.example: The Sales Value requested is greater than Creditsafe's recommended credit limit.

Audits.description: An array of audit values. The parameters output for audit are tailored and bespoke to each decision tree.

description.description: The value for the audit parameter at the point in time in which the decision tree was run.

RuleName.description: The friendly name for the audit parameter.

originationId.description: Displays the optional text passed through to be stored against the decision in the original call to `/{provenirId}`. Typically used for internal identifiers (e.g. SalesForce IDs).

statusCode.description: The status of the decision. typically, 1 is reserved for positive outcomes, 2 for pending status and 3 for negative outcomes.

totalCount.description: The total number of previous decisions matching the defined filter criteria.

decisionLogId.description: The unique identifier for the decision log.

provenirId.description: The unique identifier of the decision tree.

friendlyName.description: The name of the decision tree.

userId.description: The unique identifier for the user's account, used across the Creditsafe product suite.

companyId.description: The connectId of the company that the decision was ran on. A connectId is the primary Company identifier that is used to uniquely identify all companies across Creditsafe's Universe and Partner Network.

companyName.description: The name of the company that the decision was ran on.

modifiedDate.description: The timestamp that this decision was last modified.

scanText.example: The Sort Code and Account Number provided does not match the company UK07499628.

Connect.Identity.Gender.description:
Below is a list of Definitions for the ENUM
* 0 - Unknown
* 1 - Male
* 2 - Female

customerId.description: ID value of a cusomter account, typically passed in to allow users to retrieve past searches on a customer.

userId.description: ID value of the user account, a customer account may have multiple user accounts, this is typically passed in to retrieve past searches by a user.

reference.description: A string value that a user can submit during their search. This reference value is stored alongside the search details/customer/user ID values. Is typically passed in to allow users to retrieve past searches based on the reference value supplied.

isInternal.description: A boolean value that is handled API side to check whether an account is internal/active. NOTE: Should not be required for external use.

Consumer Specific Search Criteria.description: Used for consumer search only. Can provide a second unique second person into the search.

thirdPartyOptIn.description: Is always set to false on ID/AML/Bankmatch searches. Can be set to true on Consumer searches if need be. If true, does an additional charge against the user account to allow for more data coverage.

products.description:
Below is a list of Definitions for the ENUM
* 0 - Consumer
* 1 - Id
* 2 - AML
* 3 - Bank Match
* 4 - AML with Bank Match
